page.title: 11LONG ASHTON VILLAGE CHURCH
page.content: The old church was built in the fourteenth century. Long Ashton is lucky because we have three churches, but this is the biggest. I expect it could hold about three hundred people. The church has four rooms and two in the tower, not including the boiler room. Behind the church is a big monument. This is called the Long Ashton Cross. It is about ten feet high, and about the same around the base. The screen is one of the best in the south west of England. It is made of oak and coated with gold. The church also contains a striking fifteenth-century monument in the Lady Chapel. The church has various activities associated with it, like bell-ringing and choir.
